p: Among the foods likely to be contaminated by enteric viruses, there is the shellfish, such as mussels and oysters. These bivalve molluscs feed by filtration of the water. By this mechanism, they accumulate the pathogens contained in the water along with the human enteric viruses. These shells shellfish are mainly consumed raw or undercooked.
